column1: Chai Nat (Thai: ชัยนาท
column2: pronounced [t͡ɕʰāj nâːt]) is a town (thesaban mueang) in central Thailand
column3: capital of Chai Nat Province. It covers the whole tambon tambon Nai Mueang and parts of Ban Kluai
column4: Tha Chai and Khao Tha Phra
column5: all in Mueang Chai Nat district. As of 2006 it had a population of 14

column1: The town is on the banks of the Chao Phraya River. The main road through the town is Phahonyothin Road (Highway 1). Bangkok lies 188 km to the south.
